title: Olivia Newton-John shares a kiss with John Easterling ahead of her auction in Beverly Hills
text:
Olivia Newton-John is auctioning off some of her most iconic prized possessions to help raise funds for Cancer Wellness & Research Centre in Melbourne.

And on Tuesday the film and music icon, 71, shared a smooch with her husband John Easterling, 67, on the red carpet ahead of the sale, held at Julien's Auctions in Beverly Hills.

She dressed for the event in a bejewelled beige shirt with trousers, silver slip-on sneakers and a long black kimono.

Kiss for luck! Olivia Newton-John and her husband John Easterling shared a smooch on the red carpet ahead of an auction for her iconic prized possessions in Beverly Hills on Tuesday

Meanwhile, her partner of 11 years looked dapper in a navy blazer, blue striped shirt, and black trousers.

Inside the auction house, the legendary Australian singer and actress showed off some of the prized possessions she would parting with.

One of which is the iconic leather jacket and skintight pants, worn in the movie Grease as she performed her hit song, You're The One That I Want.

For a good cause! The legendary Australian singer and actress is auctioning off some of her prized possessions to help raise funds for Cancer Wellness & Research Centre in Melbourne

Another item from the 1978 musical up for auction is her Pink Ladies Jacket, with Sandy's name embroidered on it.

Other items Olivia is putting up for auction, include outfits from her 1981 music video for Physical, costumes from the film Xanadu and her pink dress worn at the 1978 Academy Awards.

Over 500 items from Olivia's collection will go under the hammer on Friday, November 1 and Saturday, November 2.

Part of the funds raised from the auction will go toward providing cancer treatment services, education, training and research at the ONJ CancerCentre.

Under the hammer: One of which is the iconic leather jacket and skin tight pants, worn in Grease as she performed her hit song, You're The One That I Want

The Xanadu star was diagnosed with breast cancer in 2017. She had previously battled the disease twice before, in 1992 and 2013.

Olivia has made no secret of the fact she uses medical marijuana to deal with pain and improve her quality of life while undergoing other treatments.

She told Ten Daily earlier this year: 'I was flat on my back in the centre [the Olivia Newton-John Cancer Wellness & Research Centre] and this year, through treatment and medicinal cannabis, I am feeling fantastic.'

'I hope to be able to soon offer that to everyone - that's my dream.'
